item.title: Visualizing and pruning the docker image tree
item.description: Visualizing the Docker image dependency tree is a useful way of checking image sizes and inter-image dependencies. Since images occupy a lot of disk space, we may also want to prune unused images. Visualizing image dependencies In version 1.2.0 of Docker, the image dependency tree is available via the docker images --tree command: $ docker images --tree Warning: '--tree' is deprecated, it will be removed soon.
